sub_topic: The relationship between the Julia set and the Mandelbrot set.
message_1:
Calculate the area of the largest connected section of the Mandelbrot set using the formula: 

A = πr^2 

where r is the distance from the center of the section to its farthest point. Round your answer to the nearest thousandth.
message_2:
The largest connected section of the Mandelbrot set is the main cardioid. The farthest point from the center of the main cardioid is at a distance of r = 2 (since the main cardioid has a diameter of 2).

Using the formula A = πr^2, we can calculate the area of the largest connected section:

A = π(2)^2
A = π(4)
A = 4π

Approximating the value of π as 3.14159, we get:

A ≈ 4 * 3.14159
A ≈ 12.56636

Rounded to the nearest thousandth, the area of the largest connected section of the Mandelbrot set is approximately 12.566.
